item.description:
WGBH’s Basic Black invites you to an exclusive studio

event:              

Could You Get On The Bus?  The Call for Civil Engagement — then and now.

Filmmaker Stanley Nelson joins the Basic Black panel to discuss his film FREEDOM RIDERS from AMERICAN EXPERIENCE

               

Watch Basic Black in WGBH’s atrium as it’s broadcast live from Studio B Network with professionals of color and Boston’s filmmaking community

 

Mr. Nelson will be joined on the panel by:

Callie Crossley, host, The Callie Crossley Show Phillip Martin, 89.7 WGBH Senior Investigative Reporter Kim McLarin, writer-in-residence, Emerson College Peniel Joseph, professor of history, Tufts University

 

Meet & Greet with Basic Black panelists and contributors after the show!

 

Friday, May 20th at 6:30pm

Show begins at 7:30pm

WGBH’s Brighton Studios

One Guest Street, Brighton

 

Complimentary cocktail reception

Free parking

RSVP at http://www.wgbh.org/basicblackevent

 

For more information about FREEDOM RIDERS, visit http://www.wgbh.org/freedomriders Basic Black — smart conversations exploring the Black experience.
